headline: Blueberry Banana Bread
description: This banana blueberry bread is made with mashed ripe bananas and fresh blueberries for a delicious morning baked treat or quick afternoon snack.
name: Blueberry Banana Bread

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 3 mini loaf pans.
Mix together flour, baking soda, and salt in a medium bowl.

Beat sugar and butter with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light in color and fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Stir in vanilla extract; beat in mashed bananas. Add flour mixture a little at a time, beating until just combined into a thick batter. Fold in blueberries until evenly distributed. Pour batter into the prepared loaf pans.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 30 to 35 minutes. Cool in the pans for 10 minutes, then transfer loaves to cool completely on a wire rack.

review.reviewBody: I liked it, added about a teaspoon and a half of cinnamon.
The recipe for blueberry banana bread is amazingly delicious. Definitely will make again! .
Added walnuts and cooked two minis and one small loaf pan. Minis were 40 minutes and loaf was 45 minutes. I think a half to one teaspoon of baking powder would be a good addition.
It was very good, I did have to bake it longer

The bread came out fluffy and moist! I tried it for the first time and it's excellent! I did somehow made these changes: 1. 1 cup AP flour + 1 cup oat flour instead of 2 cups of AP flour. 2. 1/2 cup of brown sugar + 1/4 cup of white sugar instead of 1 full cup of white sugar (still it came out very sweet so I suggested to reduce it even more. 3. Added 1 spoon of whole fat milk 4. Buttered 2 regular aluminum baking foil pans and dusted brown sugar + cinnamon powder at the bottom and at the top of the bread (highly recommended!) 5. Coated the blueberries with flour so that it won't sink 6. Added chopped walnuts for some crunch and 1 medium banana slices for topping decoration 7. It definitely took over 45 minutes to bake it, I guess every oven is different.
great bread!
Followed recipe, except I only had frozen blueberries, which I thawed and rinsed. Used an 8 loaf mini pan and baked for 30 minutes. Perfection.
I made this GF using 1 on 1 King Arthur flour. It turned out well, but I had to cook it longer -- about 12 minutes.

Very easy to bake! It turned out very fluffy and light, if that's what you want. I halfed the recipe and cooked it for 25 minutes (cook 30 to 35 since I like it a bit raw) and it turned out perfect! I added my own chocolate chips and it tasted fantastic! I will be making this again! :D
I use this recipe a lot and have frozen many loaves when I make a batch. It tastes so moist and freezes so well. Love it.
Yummy... 1/3 cup of sugar, 1 cup of rice flour + 1 cup of oatmeal.
Great recipe and very easy. I added sliced almonds folded in at the end. Topped with sliced almonds and fres

This bread is delicious and moist. I made it in one loaf pan and it took about one hour and 20 minutes to cook. After the first 45 minutes I tented with foil so it would not brown too much. It is absolutely wonderful.

This is the first time (and not the last) I made this recipe. I had some riponed bananas on hand and defrosted some blueberries from last summer. I couldn't find my mini pans so I used my 9 x 5 pan. Other than the pan, I didn't make any changes to the recipe. OMG! My boyfriend, his son and I LOVE it!! Perfect banana flavor with a plump, juicy blueberry surprise! Thank you so much for sharing! ??
The batter was excessively thick, so I added about 1T of whole milk.

Was a great recipe I made 4 mini loaves. 2 with straight recipe then added chopped walnuts to remaining batter .sprinkled blueberries on top and halved walnuts on the nut bread.
Moist and tasty.
This was great! I used frozen blueberries and made one large loaf. Took over an hour to cook.
I followed the recipe and it was great! Hubby liked it so it's a keeper. I would have liked a bit more blueberry taste.

Absolutely delicious and moist. However, didn't know what size loaf pan is "small". So I used 2 regular 9" loaf pans and they came out a little small. Would be fine made in 1 regular-size pan - just have to watch the timing of the bake.

I made it the way they called for the first time ...the second time I used 2 mini loafs and buttered them in stead of greasing .
2 eggs
I put a mixture of cinnamon sugar on the sides of my rubber mini pans with flour on the bottom post buttering also I used 2 x blueberries wet then then dusted them in flour so not as many sank to the bottom, then I added 1/4 cup sour cream in a bowl with 1tsp baking soda mixing well let it sit till it foamed up some before mixing in at the same time as bananas gave it more moisture. Also added about 4 or 5 more tablespoons of sifted! flour to compensate for extra blueberries. On the top I cup up 1/2 inch thick slices of a regular banana spaced out across batter just barely sprinkled with cinnamon sugar looked great when it came out of the oven ...baked about 45min at 350 or until toothpick comes out clean came out awesome ....
I made this with Splenda instead of sugar for a diabetic friend who said it was wonderdul.
I used an 8x8 pan. I also added an extra banana and floured the blueberries.
I didn’t really change anything,except that I added more blueberries. I just had extra. Used 2 loaf pans. I love this

I wanted to like it, but it was too dry. Not sweet enough to be cake, but too sweet for bread. I won't use this recipe again. 
I learned from the British Baking Show that if you coat fresh fruit in flour before folding into the mix, the fruit won't sink to the bottom. It did work.
I added 1 cup walnuts and 1 tsp cinnamon and made muffins instead of loaves. Baked for 25 minutes. Delicious! Grandkids love to help themselves!
Perfect basic (all ingredients should be in your pantry!) recipe for a great tasting loaf. I always add 1/2 cup unsweetened apple sauce to my recipe for a super moist loaf!
This is my new go to banana bread recipe. I've made it with cranberries, and blueberries, and frozen mixed berries

Made this bread today and it turned out very well. The batter was a little sweet for my taste but not objectionable. The vanilla taste definitely came through but was ok. The instructions say to use 3 small pans. I'm not sure what "size" that may be but the batter was too much for my mini pans so I had to use a regular loaf pan. Mine baked for 55 min. in my convection oven which was probably 5 min. too long. Will definitely make again and cover the top about half way through since the top came out a little crunchy. Hubby definitely liked this bread.
Made 12 delicious muffins! Used a little more than 1 cup of frozen blueberries tossed with 1 tsp. of flour & baked for 25 minutes.
Used 3 bananas like suggested. Cooked in 4 miniloaf pans for 25 minutes. Came out perfect!
Followed recipe-except one large loaf pan. Husband said it was the best!
It was great! My 2 year old and I had an activity this morning. Half the batter was blueberry, half strawberry. Equally delicious.

I purchased an 18 oz box of blueberries. That is 2 cups. I didn't have 3 small pans so used one loaf pan. Increased the time to one hour and the top cracked. I am doing it again for 45 minutes. My bananas had been in the freezer so when they thawed I mashed them and added them. I found when I cut the bread the next day the slices tended to crumble. You need to cut thicker slices than normal quick breads. I really didn't taste the banana.

This is an excellent recipe! The bread was so moist and full of flavor. I have Celiac Disease so I used gluten-free flour and added 1 tsp of baking powder as it helps gluten-free breads to rise. Everything else I followed to the T - even the instructions as to adding the eggs. There are very few tasty recipes that can be converted to gluten free. This is a keeper!
It was pretty easy and taste good. I also added unsweetened coconut to it. It was scrumptious.

Yummy, but needs more bananas. I didn't have any blueberries so I used frozen cranberries. I also split the sugar between white & brown, added 1 tsp of baking powder & 1 tsp of cinnamon and increased the vanilla to 4 teaspoons. Recipe made 17 muffins.

Best I've Made yet, I couldn't wait to get Pic Myself and Grandson took it to task Before I could, the Only thing I did off the Recipe was a Dusting of Brown and White Sugar Cinnamon a few Minutes prior to Removing from Heat.
I am going to be Making this one Again!
Delish! The only thing I did was use 3 bananas, because I had them Very very good, especially warm with cream cheese !

I baked it for 32 minutes using a Bundt pan and it was nice and moist. With a cup of sugar, it wasn’t too sweet, but it was perfect for me as I don’t like it very sweet. I also added some chopped walnuts and pecans before I baked it. It was delicious and it made my house smell good while it was baking.

This recipe is really easy once you get everything together and the banner at first is really smooth and you think it's a little bit too smooth but it's not. If you add the bananas and then you add the blueberries and used to have a little bit of space if you wish to add some walnuts if you like it's really good. It's dense but light when it's finished. It's a really good mix I added a cinnamon sugar sprinkle on top and that is just Olga schitts good. Well done well done.
Great recipe! I made it exactly as directed and it came out Amazing. No additions or substitutions needed!

I’ve made this bread every week for the last few months. My family and friends love it! We have it for breakfast or dessert. I make one loaf pan and cook it for about an hour, I’ve also added other berries when I had extra and even used frozen blueberries before. You can’t go wrong with this bread!

These are great! I made this recipe, exactly as posted. I made the muffins a reviewer suggested...makes 12 regular size. Baked for 23 minutes, or until tops are slightly browned.
 The kids love them!

Delicious! Made recipe just as it said. Didn't have small loaf pans so I just used two regular and filled them about half full. Cooked 30 minutes, covered with foil and then back in for another 8 minutes to finish but not allow the sides to burn. Will be doing this again!
Moist and delicious! I made it as one loaf and baked it for about 65 minutes.
Fantastic recipe! I went the muffin route and they turned out big, airy, and super delicious.
Made just as the recipe called for and I love it. Great flavor combination.
I love this recipe. I make it in a large loaf pan, the cooking time is 60-65 minutes. I especially love the crispy outer layer and the moistness of the bread.
Love it so moist. Added nuts!
This has become my standard banana bread recipe. I make one every week! My family loves it.
Love this Banana Blueberry Loaf! It is light and not overly sweet. I do use 1/2 cup refined white sugar and 1/2 cup coconut sugar . Great recipe!

Pretty good recipe! 
However, it took a little closer to 45 minutes to bake through. I also use two regular sized loaf pans rather than 3 small.
This is soo delicious!!
Tasted awesome and will be making as often as i can....
excellent recipe. followed to the EXACT ingredients. family loved it. will do it again.
I think it was great! I think I should have maybe taken it out at around 28-29 minutes, though, and I added a bit more blueberries since they're my favorite!

I did not change or add to any ingredients. However, 30 minutes is simply not long enough to bake these loaves. I tested them at 25, 40, and 45 minutes, and they were still not cooked at the center top. We ended up nuking the slices in the microwave. They were delicious, by the way.
Nice variation on banana bread. I used 3 bananas, splash of lemon juice on the mashed bananas so they don't turn dark, and 1/2 tsp cinnemon
Added blueberries to one pan, then added walnuts to the other pan.
I followed the directions exactly and doubled the recipe to get 6 small loaves. They came out moist and flavorful and good enough to share.
Wasn’t my favorite, but still good none the less! Definitely recommend
I made this amazing, quick, easy treat today! I modified as suggested with an extra banana and a little sugar on top. I also used the tip about a little flour on the blueberries. It is fantastic!!
Only wanted 6 muffins so halved the recipe and incorporated a number of other bakers’ suggestions; floured the blueberries, canola + applesauce...
I added lemon zest (found on another review of recipe), and baked as muffins for 23 minutes. My husband and in-laws loved them.
Great recipe! Very easy to perfect! Definitely a keeper!!

My go-to starter recipe. And I mean that in a good way. This time I changed up the recipe only a bit. I creamed butter and sugar (half cane and half brown sugar) then added vanilla, big dash nutmeg and cinnamon, 4 bananas (I’ve used more in past), added dry ingredients last and as called for, I folded in the fruits, using 1 1/2 cup giant blueberries coated with flour and 1 cup walnuts. I buttered pans and used cane sugar instead of flour to coat over top of butter. Learned that from Paul Hollywood and Mary Berry in their British Baking show. While hot, loosen sides and remove to cool on rack. Comes out much easier than letting bread cool in pan and gives a nice outer crunch. Clean up is easier too. ;) Baked 15 minutes longer, reduced heat to 335 midway, and covered with foil once a bit browned (it continues to brown. Anyway, came out delicious!! Thanks for the recipe.
Delicious!!! All I did different was to use dark brown sugar and then sprinkled a little of it on top before baking. Used two smaller pans and baked about one hour!!
Loved the lemon in the recipie! Very good and moist!

The recipe has a good flavor, but I think it is more suited to muffins, than a loaf pan. First of all, the submitter did not specify SIZE of the "small" pans. I have 2 different sizes of bread pans, so since I did not have 3 small ones, I prepared 2 large ones. I messed up a pan unnecessarily, because all of the dough filled one pan, a 9 1/4" x 5 1/4", only halfway. I realized, too late, that the "small" referred to by the submitter must be 5 3/4" x 3 1/4". Of course, the single loaf needed more baking time than was specified. Secondly, the loaf had a cake-like texture, instead of the coarse texture of a quick bread This recipe would be much better suited to muffins, and please look to Sarah Jo's review for them.
Easy to follow, fast to make and very delicious with a bust of the blueberry melting in your mouth.
Made this recipe about 5 times now and onto the 6th! Family tried some and now I'm baking it for them. Absolutely gorgeous, definalty a winner!
Very good, the only thing I changed was 1 cup of xylitol instead of sugar
This recipe is fantastic. I personally like it better with three bananas instead of two.

I have made this recipe 5 times so far, including halving the recipe so I can add Splenda for two diabetic friends. Not sure how those will turn out as they are just now in the oven. So far they look great. As far as I’m concerned this is my go-to recipe. I love it because I don’t need to keep baking powder around (which I don’t use), the recipe is simple, the bread is moist and delish!! Sorry, I didn’t use blueberries. But I did cut up some fresh pecans my hub was an angel to shell for me. Seriously awesome!! I will review again when I hear from my diabetic friends.

So I altered the recipe a bit. First off, I used stevia instead of sugar (a little less than a cup). I also used about 2 and a half bananas because I wanted the flavor to really come through. Then, I followed Sarah Jo's suggestion and used a muffin tin at 350 for 22ish minutes. My muffins were small but tasty. Next time, I'll try substituting half of the flour with oats and maybe some of the butter with coconut oil. My goal is to make an almost completely healthy muffin that's also tasty.
Made it like it says
This recipe was really good..I made it Gluten Free with King Arthur’s All Purpose GF flour and it turned out great..I added a streusel topping with some coconut.
it's still cooking but the smell alone is divine! I added 1/4 cinnamon and also decided to split the batter - loaf with blueberries and muffins without blueberries
Excellent recipe! Followed it exactly and it was sooo flavorful! This will be my go-to recipe for banana blueberry bread!
I made this recipe as it said except I used gluten free Red Mill all purpose flour since my son has Celiacs Disease. It came out delicious!!
Recipe was perfect as is!

This was my first time making any kind of banana bread and it turned out awesome! I was nervous because of the way it looked after adding the banana but once I started adding the flour mixture, it looked normal again. Lol. Really good recipe...
Love it!! I drizzled the top with vanilla frosting. You could also sprinkle with powdered sugar.
This was a wonderful surprise! Moist and flavorful even though I was short 1 banana. Added 1/2 cup of walnuts as I live but breads. I'll definitely share this with family and friends.

Very good! The only things I did different were I used 2 cups frozen blueberries, and made muffins instead of loaves, and sprinkled the tops with raw sugar before baking. They turned green because of the frozen blueberries, but they taste good. It made 18 small muffins (cupcake size, not mini) and I baked them for 22 minutes. Otherwise I followed the recipe. I will make these again. Basic muffins, nothing fancy. Not too sweet, perfect for breakfast Had all the ingredients on hand. Im always looking for ways to use bananas that are over ripe!
this was a hit with my son and I loved it
I used this recipe to create bite size muffins. I shortened the baking time due to the smaller size. They turned out moist and sweet little bites. Will make again.
Very light and moist. I used brown sugar instead of white and doubled the blueberries. My fiancé and I enjoyed this with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top!

I used a few pointers from other reviewers (cut back on total sugar and used 1/2 brown and 1/2 white) and added a shake of cinnamon (both for health benefits and banana friendly flavor enhancement) but otherwise followed the directions exactly. Good thing I checked for doneness - my small loaf pans only needed 23-24 minutes to be baked thoroughly. We liked the flavor but found the bread to be on the dry side . . if I make it again I think I'll increase the amount of butter or add a dollop of sour cream for extra moisture.
Where's the liquid? I added 2cups + of butter milk, came out perfect, better get liquid in the receipe or you'll have a few irate loafers, ha!!
very good
I took the advice of using 1/2 white and 1/2 brown sugar. Made it so tasty! I don't think I can ever make banana bread without blueberries now. They add just a bit of tartness that is delightful.
Delicious! I added another banana and baked it for 10 more minutes. It came out so good
I would definitely make this again! I added raspberries while making it though to use up my berries:) It was so moist and had the perfect sweetness!
I took it to work and it was gone in no time. It was really good. I did dust my blueberries with flour as suggested by another review. Other than that I changed nothing.

I have made twice with a few changes and it came out great! I substituted 1\2 cup of the white sugar with brown sugar. I also made a chocolate chip, white chocolate chip pecan crunch topping. My family really enjoyed.
Delicious!
Made this the other day with my toddler. Not to sweet and easy to make with a toddler being a helper. We substituted Saskatoon berries instead of the blueberries and oh my gosh sooooo yummy.
The easiest and yummiest bread ever!!!!!
